TopicTitle: things getting all splody at the KSC for no apparent reason

Articles.Content:
Howdy,

The 0.90 update happened while I was in the middle of playing a Jool 5 mission in sandbox mode, so I've been finishing the mission with a 0.25 save. While I was making the final approach trying to land my all-stock, low part count space plane Laythe lander back at on the KSC runway, part of the right wing just exploded off in mid air. I actually managed to get the plane on the ground without killing the pilot, but just as I touched down the other wing exploded too, and then the KSP Launchpad, which had nothing on it, had a tremendous explosion off in the distance as well! I don't have access to a screen shot right now, but I'll post one later. Several subsequent attempts produced similar results until finally I was able to get on the ground with nothing spontaneously exploding. The plane was all stock, and had been flown and landed without incident in 0.25 several times before. Anyhow, this definitely seems like some kind of new bug to me...

Edited December 22, 2014 by herbal space program

You're right, it is a bug. Unfortunately it isn't new, and it's really hard to replicate. It seems to generally have to do with taking a spaceplane farther from Kerbin than just LKO, and returning. (Although that's not strictly required either.)

If you can find a way to repeat it reliably, we would all be interested.

Cheers,

~Claw
